item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "A book is a garden, an orchard, a storehouse, a party, a company by the way, a counselor, a multitude of counselors." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "When I got [my] library card, that was when my life began." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "A good title is the title of a successful book." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "There is more treasure in books than in all the pirates' loot on Treasure Island and best of all, you can enjoy these riches every day of your life." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Dwight D. Eisenhower
item.description: "Don't join the book burners. Don't think you're going to conceal faults by concealing evidence that they ever existed. Don't be afraid to go in your library and read every book..." -- Dwight D. Eisenhower

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Jean Fritz
item.description: "When I discovered libraries, it was like having Christmas every day." -- Jean Fritz

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Harry Golden
item.description: "The library, I believe, is the last of our public institutions to which you can go without credentials. You don't even need the sticker on your windshield that you need to get into the public beach. All you need is the willingness to read." -- Harry Golden

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Alberto Manguel
item.description: "Life happened because I turned the pages." -- Alberto Manguel

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Jan Morris
item.description: "Book lovers will understand me, and they will know too that part of the pleasure of a library lies in its very existence." -- Jan Morris

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Anthony Powell
item.description: "Books do furnish a room." -- Anthony Powell

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Roger Rosenblatt
item.description: "A library should be like a pair of open arms." -- Roger Rosenblatt

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Charles de Secondat
item.description: "I've never know any trouble than an hour's reading didn't assuage. " -- Charles de Secondat

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Deborah Lawrenson
item.description: "I marveled at how they were all closed up, asleep with their secrets unseen until you reached up and took the book down from the shelf." -- Deborah Lawrenson

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Jerry Spinelli
item.description:
"Live today. Not yesterday. Not tomorrow. Just today. Inhabit your moments. Don’t rent them out to tomorrow. Do you know what you’re doing when you spend a moment wondering how things are going to turn out with Perry?
You’re cheating yourself out of today. Today is calling to you, trying to get your attention, but you’re stuck on tomorrow, and today trickles away like water down a drain. You wake up the next morning and that today you wasted is gone forever. It’s now yesterday. Some of those moments may have had wonderful things in store for you , but now you’ll never know." -- Jerry Spinelli

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Well, we all make mistakes, dear, so just put it behind you. We should regret our mistakes and learn from them, but never carry them forward into the future with us." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Melody Carlson
item.description: "I’ll never be lonely Even if I am alone For I've a precious Savior Who’ll come to take me home. But while I’m here His servant I will be With one foot on earth And one in eternity. And I’ll gather His crops To populate His land And if I feel weary I’ll cling tighter to his hand." -- Melody Carlson

item.title: Magpie67 add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Give yourself permission to dream. Fuel your kids' dreams too. Once in a while, that might even mean letting them stay up past their bedtimes." -- Randy Pausch
